title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro played briefly for the Bruins after Joonas Korpisalo was injured in a game against Columbus.
DiPietro was an emergency recall from Providence, covering for Jeremy Swayman who was resting post-Olympics.
Korpisalo returned after 6 minutes, allowing only 2 more goals in the Bruins' 4-2 victory.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, of Manchester, N.H., arrested for reckless second-degree murder of her infant daughter in March 2025.
The infant, referred to as Baby Jane Doe, was found dead in Pine Island Pond, Manchester, on March 27, 2025.
Authorities announced the charge citing 'extreme indifference to the value of human life'; investigation remains active.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader with a 2006 Mazda3 had their black transmission fluid drained and refilled, advised to flush in 10,000 miles.
A dealership quoted $1,600 for repairs on a 2019 Subaru Crosstrek; cheaper options may exist for tire sensor replacement.
A minor antifreeze reservoir issue on a 2018 GMC Denali may be due to evaporation, advised to monitor periodically.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham evacuated due to roof showing structural stress from snow accumulation.
Students were safely relocated to Hingham High School with lunch and transportation home provided.
Hingham recorded over 17 inches of snow from Monday's blizzard, prompting roofing specialists to assess the roof.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz recently expressed renewed support for Rafael Devers in a podcast interview despite past criticism.
Ortiz previously criticized Devers for poor defense and attitude issues leading to his trade to the Giants in 2025.
Devers refused a position change after Boston's roster shifts, contributing to his departure from the Red Sox.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Explosion at 78 Plain St. in Taunton caused by a gas leak destroyed a home and injured two people.
A 25-year-old mother and her 2-year-old daughter were seriously injured and hospitalized after the incident.
Community fundraisers have raised over $33,000 for the injured family, with additional support for other displaced residents.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots ranked 26th out of 32 teams in the 2026 NFLPA report card, showing slight improvement.
Key criticisms include the team's travel resources, especially an outdated airplane, and low quality food program.
The Patriots are building a new facility set to open in 2026 to address their facility shortcomings.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, 54, a Malden teacher and coach, was arraigned for allegedly raping an 18-year-old foster student.
Charges include two counts of rape and supplying alcohol; Marino pleaded not guilty in Woburn District Court.
Marino was released on $75,000 bail with conditions, including no contact with the victim and GPS monitoring.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: State Police Sergeant Joel Daoust charged with assault and battery after a traffic stop in Springfield on Jan. 3.
Daoust allegedly used physical force and pepper spray on a driver during the stop for speeding and lanes violations.
Daoust, previously disciplined in 2015 and 2017, is suspended without pay and expected for arraignment on April 3.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Governor Maura Healey plans to introduce an AI assistant, powered by ChatGPT, in the Massachusetts executive branch.
65% of over 100 Massachusetts readers oppose the AI rollout, citing security, privacy, and environmental concerns.
Governor Healey defends the initiative, stating it will improve government efficiency and provide free AI training for all residents.
